title: Set uploaded image as static hero logo, display instantly without flash

requirements.text: Save the uploaded Kingston Customizations logo image (IMG_2219.jpeg — cream background with dark brown crown and script lettering) as a static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/logo.png and use it as the hero logo image in the Hero component. The image must be loaded directly from this static path (not fetched from the backend) so it appears instantly on page load with no flash, placeholder, or other image showing first. All other content and layout in the Hero component must remain unchanged.

quotes: I need this image to be the hero logo image. I need it to show immediately without other images showing first. keep everything else the same

acceptanceCriteria: The uploaded Kingston Customizations logo (cream background, dark brown crown and script) is visible in the Hero section immediately on page load.
No other image, placeholder, skeleton, or blank flash appears before the logo renders.
The logo is served from a static asset path (e.g., /assets/generated/logo.png) and does not depend on a backend fetch to display.
All other Hero component content (headline, tagline, layout, styling) remains unchanged.
The logo also does not flash in the Header component — if the Header previously used the backend-fetched logo, it should also reference the same static asset so it renders instantly.

constraints: Do not change any content, layout, or styling in the Hero component beyond replacing the logo source.
Do not modify immutable frontend paths (hooks, main.tsx, ui components).
The logo must be served as a static file — do not route it through the backend.
nonGoals: Redesigning or restyling the Hero section.
Changing any other page sections (Header, Footer, Services, Gallery, About, Contact).
Modifying backend image storage or upload logic.
Removing the admin ability to upload logos via the backend.

required: Kingston Customizations logo: cream/off-white background with a dark brown royal crown above the script word 'Kingston' and arched uppercase 'CUSTOMIZATIONS' text below (logo.dim_512x512.png)
